intro: Lesourdia, commonly known as the African buttercup, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae and is characterized by its showy, yellow flowers with a distinctive cup-shaped structure. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full sunlight. Lesourdia has palmate leaves that are deeply lobed, adding to its ornamental appeal. It is often cultivated in gardens for its vibrant blooms and relatively low maintenance requirements.
